channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Airbnb’s Algorithm: How Often Should You Update Your Listing?
item.description: Is there a way to game Airbnb's algorithm?

item.title: Cruise clears key hurdle to getting robotaxis back on roads in California
item.description: Cruise, the self-driving subsidiary of General Motors, has agreed to pay a $112,500 fine for failing to provide full information about an accident involving one of its robotaxis last year. The settlement with the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) not only avoids litigation, it puts Cruise in a position to restart operations in the state. […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Wants to Allow Some Votes From Jails and Prisons. Red Tape May Stop It.
item.description: A new state law will allow more people in jails and prisons to cast absentee ballots, but many obstacles remain.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: New York City’s Real Estate Brokerages Could to Be Destroyed By a New Law
item.description: NYC has a bill on the table that could reshape its real estate industry forever.

item.title: Pitch Deck Teardown: Feel Therapeutics’ $3.5M seed deck
item.description: Feel Therapeutics has a pretty original deck, with some twists we rarely see; the company did a great job telling the overall story. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Minneapolis Cop Who Beat Him Pleaded Guilty. He Still Fears the Department Won’t Change.
item.description: Jaleel Stallings was swept up in the chaos of protests over George Floyd’s murder. The outcome changed his life.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: How to Spot a Fake Guru: 6 Signs It Could Be a Scam
item.description: Here are red flags that should make you skeptical about spending thousands of dollars on guru training.

item.title: OpenAI buys Rockset to bolster its enterprise AI
item.description: OpenAI has acquired Rockset, which builds tools to drive real-time search and data analytics. In a post on its official blog, OpenAI said that it would integrate Rockset‘s technology to “power [its] infrastructure across products.” Members of Rockset’s team will join OpenAI, and Rockset’s existing customers will be transitioned off of Rockset’s platform “gradually.” The […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: More States Restricting ‘Excited Delirium’ as Cause of Death in Police Custody
item.description: Authorities use the term to describe the condition of some people who die. But some medical organizations say it’s useless or racist pseudoscience.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: BiggerNews: Rent Price Updates and Why Landlords Are Optimistic About 2024
item.description: The rental market could finally be returning to stability after a wild past four years. Since 2020, we’ve seen rent prices skyrocket almost overnight, with huge asking price increases for […]

item.title: U.S. government sanctions Kaspersky executives
item.description: The U.S. government announced Friday sanctions against twelve executives and senior leaders of the Russia-based cybersecurity giant Kaspersky. In a press release, the Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) said it designated the twelve company executives to protect internet users against malicious cyber threats. “Today’s action against the leadership of Kaspersky […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Criminal Justice Journalist Wrestles With Doubts in the Jury Box
item.description: A longtime journalist serving on a jury must weigh the flaws of the system against the holes in the gun and drug case he heard.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Rookie Reply: How to Invest with $100K & Managing Home Renovations
item.description: You have home renovations in the pipeline…but who’s going to manage them? Do you need the expertise of a general contractor, or can you manage tradespeople yourself? With so much […]

item.title: Style DNA gets a generative AI chatbot that suggests outfit ideas based on your color type
item.description: Style DNA, an AI-powered fashion stylist app, creates a personalized style profile from a single selfie. The app is particularly useful for people interested in seasonal color analysis, a process used to determine the best colors to complement an individual’s skin tone. This service can be expensive, with experts charging upwards of $300. However, the […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Behind the Black Shield: The History of a Cleveland Institution
item.description: How one of the oldest Black policing organizations in the country shaped law enforcement in Cleveland.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
